text: A cornish offering a victim as a sacrifice to Athena invited a dog to the feast. And the dog said to him, Why do you waste your possessions in vain sacrifices? Well, you should know that the goddess despises you to the point of taking all credit for your fortune-telling. And the corn-bearer said, That is why I sacrifice to him, for I know his iniquity with me, and I desire his reconciliation. If you want the tallest to hear you, you have to scream loudly.
title: El perro y la corneja
author: nan Esopo
